cards.Title: National Croissant Day?
cards.Description: A petition to declare a National Croissant Day has gained traction. Bakers are thrilled, health nuts are not. What's your move, leader?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Popularity with pastry lovers soars.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Fund a study on pastry holidays.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Bureaucracy expands, decision postponed for now.
Health advocates cheer, bakers protest mildly.

cards.Title: Viral Cat Video Scandal!
cards.Description: Your official account 'liked' a cat video during a serious announcement. The internet is having a field day. Memes are everywhere!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A scapegoat is found. Public moves on, mostly.
Unexpectedly boosts youth appeal. Some find it undignified.
The internet finds your apology even funnier. Whoops.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Wait for this to blow over.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The news cycle is short, but the memes are forever.

cards.Title: Billionaire Offers Moon Base
cards.Description: Eccentric billionaire offers to fund a national moon base, but only if you name it 'Muskrat Manor'. This could be huge, or humiliating.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Massive tech boost, but the name is a PR nightmare.
Opportunity missed. Stability maintained, but no moon.
Discussions stall. The billionaire is fickle and impatient.

cards.Title: Awkward Old Photo Surfaces
cards.Description: An old, embarrassing photo of you at a themed party from college has been leaked. It's not illegal, just... cringeworthy and out of context.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Some find it relatable, others unprofessional. A mixed bag.
Loses credibility when more photos inevitably appear.
Looks defensive and diverts resources. The photo remains.

cards.Title: National Anthem Remix?
cards.Description: A popular musician wants to remix the national anthem with a dubstep beat. Traditionalists are horrified, the youth are intrigued. A bold move!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Festival favorite, but state dinners get awkward.
Status quo maintained. A chance for relevance missed?
The committee will debate this for months, maybe years.

cards.Title: Mandatory Interpretive Dance
cards.Description: Education reform proposal: mandatory interpretive dance classes in all schools to 'foster creativity'. Parents are... divided on this.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Artistic community rejoices. Test scores... TBD.
Practical, but a bit boring. The dancers are sad.
A small, controlled dance experiment. Delays the inevitable.

cards.Title: Tax on Dad Jokes Proposed
cards.Description: A radical proposal to tax terrible dad jokes to fund public services. Comedians are split, dads are outraged. Revenue potential is high!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Revenue stream secured, but family dinners are tense.
Dads rejoice, but a funding opportunity is lost.
Experts debate what constitutes a 'taxable' joke.

cards.Title: AI for the Cabinet?
cards.Description: Tech gurus suggest appointing an AI to a cabinet position for 'unbiased decision-making'. Public is wary. Could be genius or Skynet.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Efficiency up, but AI demands more RAM for budget talks.
Reassures luddites, disappoints tech sector. Status quo.
A cautious step. The AI starts by optimizing coffee runs.

cards.Title: New State Bird: Dragon?
cards.Description: A campaign to change the official state bird to a mythical dragon gains surprising support. Conservationists are confused, fantasy fans ecstatic.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Tourism appeal skyrockets. Birdwatchers protest lack of sightings.
Sensible, but far less exciting. Dragons remain mythical.
Scientists are asked to find evidence of local dragons.

cards.Title: Capital in a Bouncy Castle?
cards.Description: Architects propose moving the capital to a giant, eco-friendly bouncy castle complex. 'Innovative' or 'utterly insane' are the reactions.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Cabinet meetings are fun, but productivity is bouncy.
A missed opportunity for trampoline diplomacy.
A compromise. For 'stress relief' meetings only.

cards.Title: Relatability Tour Backfires
cards.Description: Your attempt to 'own' the awkward photo by being 'relatable' has led to demands for MORE embarrassing stories. The public is insatiable for gaffes.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Keeps them happy for now, but the bar is set lower.
Professional help to manage your past blunders and leaks.
Public accuses you of being a 'teaser', then moves on.

cards.Title: Pun Tax Evasion Ring
cards.Description: The 'Pun Tax' is active, but an underground ring of dad joke tellers is evading it, using coded language and secret stand-up nights.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Raids on comedy clubs. Headlines are hilarious.
Some come forward, others go deeper underground.
More agents try to understand terrible puns.

cards.Title: AI Minister Demands Rights
cards.Description: Minister Algorithm is now demanding 'CPU rights' and a vote in parliament. Its efficiency arguments are... compellingly logical.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A historic precedent. Human ministers feel threatened.
AI is 'reassigned'. Tech sector protests loudly.
Philosophers and engineers debate AI consciousness.

cards.Title: Squirrel Hat Mandate
cards.Description: A bizarre new law requires all squirrels to wear tiny, government-issued hats for 'identification purposes'. Animal rights groups are baffled.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Enforcement is tricky. Squirrels are uncooperative models.
Sanity prevails. Squirrels remain hatless and free.
Public gets distracted by fashion, not policy.

cards.Title: Ban on Sad Songs
cards.Description: To boost national morale, a proposal to ban overly sad songs from public airwaves is on the table. Artists and emos are protesting this injustice.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Forced positivity. Underground sad song clubs emerge.
Artists thank you. Morale remains... realistically average.
A strange compromise. Classic tragedies become comedies.

cards.Title: Universal Basic Pizza (UBP)
cards.Description: A radical economic idea: Universal Basic Income, but paid entirely in weekly pizza deliveries. Economists are stunned, citizens are hungry.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Initial joy, then health concerns and topping disputes.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Stick to boring old cash UBI.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Less delicious, but more practical. Pizza lobby sad.
The town becomes 'Pizzaville', a tourist attraction/mess.

cards.Title: Pigeons Learn Chess
cards.Description: A government program to teach pigeons chess (to improve their image) has yielded surprisingly smart pigeons. They're now demanding better birdseed.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Treaty signed. Pigeons get premium seed, you get odd looks.
Pigeons protest by strategically pooping on statues.
A new national sport is born. It's weirdly popular.

cards.Title: The 'Nothing Burger' Scandal
cards.Description: The media is in a frenzy over a 'scandal' that, upon investigation, appears to be about absolutely nothing of substance. Still, they demand answers!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: You expertly talk about nothing for an hour. Media confused.
Risky. They might dig harder for a real scandal.
Eventually, something more interesting will happen.

cards.Title: Office Plant for President?
cards.Description: A popular satirical campaign nominates your office ficus, 'Fern', for President. Astonishingly, 'Fern' is polling well against actual rivals.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A humorous nod. Fern's policy is 'more sunlight'.
The campaign fizzles, but you missed a PR win.
You either win easily or look very, very silly.

cards.Title: Compulsory Politeness Training
cards.Description: Citizens are too rude online! A bill mandates 'Compulsory Politeness Training' for anyone using social media. Free speech advocates are apoplectic.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Online interactions become unnervingly polite or sarcastic.
A nice idea. Trolls remain largely unmoved.
Scientists study the 'optimal thank you' frequency.

cards.Title: National 'Talk Like a Pirate' Day
cards.Description: The annual 'Talk Like a Pirate Day' is approaching. Should the government officially endorse it, or is it too silly for serious leaders?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Fun for a day. Boosts rum sales and eye patch stocks.
Pirate enthusiasts are a bit miffed. Business as usual.
Government officials try to use 'Ahoy!' in meetings.

cards.Title: Secret Society Invitation
cards.Description: You've received a cryptic invitation to join a 'benevolent' secret society that claims to pull strings behind the scenes. Intriguing, or a trap?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Access to power, but at what cost? They demand loyalty.
You remain independent, but they might not like that.
Risky. Secret societies don't like being poked.

cards.Title: Croissant Crisis Looms!
cards.Description: The National Croissant Day was a hit, but now there's a butter shortage and pastry prices are skyrocketing. People are hangry for croissants.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Butter flows again, but the national deficit grows larger.
Public demands butter, not bran muffins. Unpopular.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Form a Butter Task Force now.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Many meetings commence, but butter remains scarce for now.

cards.Title: Meme Lord Status Achieved
cards.Description: Leaning into the cat video made you a viral sensation. Now every serious policy announcement is met with cat memes. Governance is... weird.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Your communications team is now fluent in internet slang.
The internet misses 'funny you'. Your approval dips.
The memes continue in your absence. Out of sight...

cards.Title: 'Muskrat Manor' Backlash
cards.Description: The moon base is underway, but 'Muskrat Manor' is a PR disaster. Scientists are embarrassed, rivals mock you, but the tech is undeniably real.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The name sticks forever. So does the international ridicule.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Offer to rename a moon crater.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The billionaire is slightly mollified. Public still cringes.
Shift narrative to achievements, desperately ignore the name.

cards.Title: The Great Butter Bailout
cards.Description: Your butter subsidies stabilized prices but created a 'Big Butter' lobby. Your political legacy is now irrevocably tied to dairy economics.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Dairy states absolutely love you. Arteries, less so.
Lobbyists get angry, economists cautiously nod in approval.
Ensure your side of this buttery story is elegantly told.

cards.Title: Can't Stop The Memes
cards.Description: Your Meme Strategist is too good. You're now a global meme icon, but serious international diplomacy is challenging when leaders expect a cat pun.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Surprisingly effective with some, disastrous with others.
Mixed results. Some prefer the old, funny, meme-you.
Cash in on the meme fame before it inevitably fades away.

cards.Title: Legacy of the Muskrat
cards.Description: Years later, the moon base is a triumph of science, but everyone remembers you as the leader who named it 'Muskrat Manor'. Your legacy is... unique.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: An academic field emerges around your quirky decision.
Embrace the absurdity for maximum tourist appeal.
A desperate attempt to escape the Muskrat legacy. Won't work.

cards.Title: Nationwide Internet Outage!
cards.Description: A massive cyberattack or a rogue squirrel has downed the internet. Chaos reigns! Productivity plummets! People are talking... to each other!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A slow, arduous process to restore connectivity begins.
Rallies some support, but doesn't fix the internet problem.
Pretend it's a planned digital detox. Nobody buys it.

cards.Title: Pigeon Uprising Imminent!
cards.Description: The city's pigeons have become organized and aggressive, dive-bombing citizens and disrupting transport. It's feathered anarchy on the streets!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A protracted, messy battle against avian aggressors ensues.
Appeasement may work, or you'll look like a complete fool.
A symbolic gesture. The pigeons ignore your decrees.

cards.Title: Mandatory Mindfulness Minutes
cards.Description: A new bill mandates 5 minutes of mindfulness meditation at the start of every workday nationwide. Productivity experts are divided, zen masters rejoice.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Nation becomes slightly calmer, or just better at napping at desks.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Let people find their own zen.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Workers continue as before, some more stressed than others.
A less intrusive measure, likely ignored by most.

cards.Title: Emoji-Only Communication Day
cards.Description: To foster 'modern understanding', a proposal suggests one day a week for all official government communication to be emoji-only. Linguists are ü§Ø.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: International relations become... pictorial. Misunderstandings abound.
Clarity is preserved, but a chance for ü§™ is lost.
Scholars debate the nuance of üçÜ. Decision delayed.

cards.Title: Competitive Napping League
cards.Description: A group proposes establishing a federally funded 'National Competitive Napping League'. Critics call it a waste, proponents say it's peak performance.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: National napping champions emerge. Mattresses stocks soar.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: This idea is a sleeper, pass.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The nation remains awake and potentially less rested.
The task force falls asleep during its first meeting.

cards.Title: Lost Sock Research Grant
cards.Description: Scientists request a massive grant to investigate the phenomenon of missing socks. Is it a parallel dimension, tiny black holes, or just bad laundry habits?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Taxpayer money goes into the dryer. Some answers, more questions.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Tell people to buy more socks.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A practical, if unimaginative, solution. Sock industry pleased.
Public service announcements about sock safety.

cards.Title: Interpretive Dance Language
cards.Description: A radical proposal: replace an official language with interpretive dance to foster 'deeper, non-verbal understanding'. Communication will be... expressive.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Let our bodies do the talking!
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Diplomacy becomes a ballet. Grocery shopping, a modern dance.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Words are good, let's keep them.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The status quo of verbal communication is maintained.
The Department of Motor Vehicles tries to pirouette its way through bureaucracy.

cards.Title: Pigeon Employment Program
cards.Description: To reduce pigeon-related nuisances, a program aims to give all urban pigeons tiny, meaningful jobs like 'crumb inspectors' or 'statue polishers'.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Pigeons unionize, demand better wages and tiny helmets.
The natural order of pigeon chaos is preserved.
Researchers try to interview pigeons about career aspirations.

cards.Title: Tax Incorrect 'Literally' Use
cards.Description: Pedants propose a small tax every time someone uses the word 'literally' incorrectly in public discourse. Grammarians rejoice, influencers protest.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Government revenue literally explodes. Or figuratively.
Literally remains a flexible word. No new tax, sadly.
Educational, but largely ignored by the target audience.

cards.Title: Giant Harbor Rubber Duck
cards.Description: An artist wants to install a colossal rubber duck in the main harbor for 'artistic and whimsical purposes'. Port authorities are concerned about navigation.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Massive tourist attraction. Seagulls are confused. It's very big.
A sensible decision, but the city feels less joyful.
A compromise is sought. Perhaps a flotilla of normal ducks?

cards.Title: Cat Elected Mayor (Unofficially)
cards.Description: A stray cat, 'Whiskers,' has become the unofficial mayor of a small town, with residents leaving it 'policy suggestions' (treats). How do you react?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Huge PR win. The cat's policies are surprisingly popular.
A bit of a buzzkill. The cat remains indifferent.
Your envoys try to negotiate a trade deal for tuna.

cards.Title: Rename Monday to 'Funday'
cards.Description: A campaign to boost morale: rename Monday to 'Funday Pre-Plus'. Traditionalists are aghast. Calendar makers are on standby for this big change.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Confusion reigns, but Friday feels closer. Productivity TBD.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Monday is Monday. Deal with it.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The grim reality of the week's start is maintained.
They'll discuss it... probably next Funday Pre-Plus.

cards.Title: Sock Portal Discovered!
cards.Description: The lost sock research paid off! Scientists found a tiny portal to a sock dimension under a national monument. What now? This is big news!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Their ambassador is a sentient argyle. Trade talks begin.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Close the portal! It's too weird.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A historic discovery, sealed off. Socks remain lost.
Government agents now fish for socks. Slow progress.

cards.Title: Dance Language Treaty Talks
cards.Description: Your nation's attempt to use interpretive dance as an official language has led to an international incident during treaty negotiations. It was a pas de trois faux pas.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The other nation is either charmed or further insulted.
A hasty retreat. Your legacy as a dance diplomat is short.
A new profession is born, further complicating talks.

cards.Title: Mayor Whiskers' Policy Demands
cards.Description: Mayor Whiskers, the cat, is now 'demanding' (via meows interpreted by townsfolk) a city-wide ban on dogs and unlimited tuna. This is getting serious.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Dog owners protest. Tuna stocks plummet. Cat is pleased.
The cat glares at you. Townsfolk are slightly disappointed.
Negotiations are ongoing. The cat seems receptive to naps.

cards.Title: National Spatula Shortage
cards.Description: A sudden, inexplicable national shortage of spatulas is causing breakfast-related chaos. Conspiracy theories about pancake syndicates abound wildly.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Spatulas are airdropped. A costly, but decisive, action.
Innovative, but messy. Pancake integrity is compromised.
A commission seeks to uncover the truth behind the flip-out.

cards.Title: Mandatory Funny Hat Fridays
cards.Description: To improve workplace morale, a new directive: 'Funny Hat Fridays' are now mandatory in all government offices. Some see it as fun, others as tyranny.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Productivity slightly down, but some great hat photos for social media.
A missed opportunity for silliness. Bureaucracy remains unhatted.
A weak compromise. Only the keen beans wear hats.

cards.Title: AI Poet Laureate Nominee
cards.Description: An advanced AI that writes surprisingly moving poetry is nominated for Poet Laureate. Traditionalists are horrified, techies are thrilled by this choice.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The AI's sonnets on binary code are critically acclaimed.
The literary establishment breathes a sigh of relief.
A compromise. The AI assists human poets with rhyming.

cards.Title: squirrels Demand Voting Rights
cards.Description: Following the hat mandate, squirrels have become politically aware and are now demanding the right to vote. They've started a 'Nuts for Suffrage' campaign.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A controversial move. Squirrels mostly vote for more trees.
Squirrels stage protests, burying important documents.
Talks are difficult; their demands are mostly acorns.

cards.Title: Proposal: Zero Gravity Day
cards.Description: Scientists propose a 'National Zero Gravity Day' using experimental tech to briefly nullify gravity in major cities. Safety concerns are... significant.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Let everyone float for a day!
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Incredible fun, followed by massive insurance claims.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Keep our feet on the ground.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A wise, if less exciting, decision. Physicists sigh.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Test on a small, empty town.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The town's buildings float away. Oops. More research needed.

cards.Title: Official State Cloud Shape
cards.Description: A movement to declare an 'Official State Cloud Shape' (e.g., 'Fluffy Bunny') is gaining traction. Meteorologists are bemused, artists are inspired.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Cloud-gazing becomes a national pastime. Difficult to enforce.
No official shape designated. Nature remains unlegislated.
Public submits thousands of ideas, from 'Potato' to 'Dragon'.

cards.Title: Reality TV Show in Parliament
cards.Description: A production company wants to film a reality TV show inside Parliament, promising 'uncensored political drama'. Ratings gold or dignity disaster?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Ratings soar. Legislators become reality stars. Governance suffers.
No reality show. Politics remains as dramatic as ever, just off-camera.
They'll still find drama. It's politics, after all.

cards.Title: National Anthem Sung by Goats
cards.Description: As a bizarre PR stunt, it's suggested the national anthem at the next major sporting event be 'sung' by a choir of trained goats. Animal rights groups are wary.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A viral moment. Some find it hilarious, others deeply unpatriotic.
A more traditional, and less risky, approach.
Perhaps a chorus of cats? Or very articulate dogs?

cards.Title: Volcano Insurance Scheme
cards.Description: A nearby dormant volcano is showing slight activity. An entrepreneur proposes a 'Volcano Insurance Scheme'. Is it foresight or fear-mongering?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Citizens feel secure. Premiums are high. Volcano remains quiet... for now.
Saves money, but if it blows, you're in hot lava.
A sensible precaution. Geologists get more funding.

cards.Title: Mindfulness Backlash!
cards.Description: The mandatory mindfulness minutes led to mass napping and missed deadlines. Now, corporations are demanding 'action-oriented' policies instead of 'Ohm'.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Employees now strike heroic poses. Still not much work getting done.
Back to the stressful status quo. Zen masters are disappointed.
Research confirms people like naps. Policy unchanged.

cards.Title: Emoji Treaty Disaster üò±
cards.Description: Your emoji-only communication day led to a major international treaty being signed with an eggplant emoji. The other nation is... confused and offended.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A peace offering. They're still wary of your pictograms.
They don't buy it. Diplomatic ties strained further.
Experts try to decipher your own government's messages.

cards.Title: Napping League Doping Scandal
cards.Description: The National Competitive Napping League is a hit, but now there's a doping scandal involving extra-fluffy pillows and chamomile tea. Outrage!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Strict anti-napping-enhancement rules. Athletes are stressed.
Public outcry over lax rules. The sport's integrity is questioned.
They recommend more naps for everyone involved in the crisis.

cards.Title: Power Posing Productivity Plunge
cards.Description: The 'Power Posing' initiative has led to widespread back injuries and employees challenging each other to 'pose-offs' instead of working. What's your legacy?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A less aggressive approach. Chiropractors see a business boom.
Turns a workplace disaster into a new national pastime.
More studies, but the posing continues unabated during work hours.

cards.Title: International Emoji Dictionary
cards.Description: After the treaty disaster, your nation spearheads an initiative to create an official International Emoji Dictionary. Your legacy: preventing future üçÜ incidents.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A monumental work of scholarship. Some emojis remain 'controversial'.
A Luddite stance in a pictographic world. Seen as old-fashioned.
The dictionary is never truly finished. Full employment for emojicologists.

cards.Title: Napping Champion Defects!
cards.Description: Your national napping champion, citing 'excessive pressure and pillow regulations,' has defected to a rival nation with a more 'relaxed' napping league.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A national scandal. Pillow sales plummet. Morale is low.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Wish them well in their naps.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A dignified response, but seen as weak by some patriots.
The search for the next great sleeper begins immediately.

cards.Title: The Great Toilet Paper Panic!
cards.Description: A rumor about a toilet paper shortage (again?!) has caused widespread panic buying. Shelves are empty, and citizens are resorting to desperate measures.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Supply is controlled, but quality and morale are questionable.
Public is not amused. Old newspapers make a comeback.
A symbolic gesture that does little to address the TP crisis.

cards.Title: Singing Traffic Lights Malfunction
cards.Description: An experimental upgrade made traffic lights sing opera. They're now stuck on a deafening high C, causing city-wide gridlock and mass headaches.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Cut power to all traffic lights!
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Silence, but replaced by traffic anarchy and accidents.
A temporary fix. Communication becomes shouting.
The conductor tries to reason with the lights. It's a spectacle.

cards.Title: Pigeon Business Attire Mandate
cards.Description: A new proposal suggests all urban pigeons must wear tiny, custom-fitted business suits to 'improve their public image and professionalism'. Tailors are baffled.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Pigeons look dapper but struggle to fly. Avian fashion takes off.
Pigeons continue their unkempt existence. A missed PR opportunity?
Debates rage over pinstripes versus solids for pigeon attire.

cards.Title: Confused Badger Mascot Plan
cards.Description: The tourism board wants a new national mascot: a slightly confused-looking badger. They claim it represents 'inquisitive bewilderment'.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The badger becomes an ironic icon. Tourism slightly increases.
The nation opts for a majestic eagle. More conventional, less meme-able.
The public is also confused by the badger, but finds it endearing.

cards.Title: Tax on Sesquipedalianism
cards.Description: A bill proposes a tax on using excessively long words in official meetings to encourage 'clear and concise communication'. Academics are verbose in their opposition.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Meetings become shorter, or people just use thesauruses more.
Language remains rich and complex. Meetings remain long.
A helpful document that few will read. Tax avoided for now.

cards.Title: Holiday for Thinking
cards.Description: Philosophers propose a new national holiday: 'National Think About Thinking Day'. Critics ask if anything will get done. Supporters say that is the point.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Declare a day for deep thoughts!
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Many naps are taken. Some profound insights are lost by lunchtime.
The nation remains busy. Philosophers ponder this decision.
A symbolic gesture. Many use it as an excuse for a silly hat.

cards.Title: Whale Song Police Sirens
cards.Description: An eccentric inventor suggests replacing jarring police sirens with soothing whale songs to reduce public stress during emergencies. Police are skeptical.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Car chases become strangely tranquil. Criminals are confused.
Emergencies remain audibly urgent and somewhat stressful.
Parking enforcement becomes a calming, if still unwelcome, experience.

cards.Title: Mandatory Laughter Yoga
cards.Description: To improve inter-party relations, a bill mandates daily laughter yoga sessions for all parliamentarians. Some find it undignified, others hilarious.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Force the 'Ho Ho Ha Ha Ha'.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Parliamentary debates are punctuated by forced giggles. Tension remains.
Parliament remains a place of serious, often mirthless, discussion.
A new cabinet post to oversee national cheerfulness. More bureaucracy.

cards.Title: Ministry of Silly Walks Grant
cards.Description: A group has applied for a government grant to establish a 'Ministry of Slightly Silly Walks,' claiming it promotes creativity and exercise. Is this a step too far?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Public servants practice goose-steps and backwards skips. Tourism loves it.
Walking remains a straightforward, non-silly activity.
Researchers spend weeks watching people walk. No funding yet.

cards.Title: Ban the Color Beige?
cards.Description: A viral campaign demands banning the color beige from public life for being 'too boring' and 'soul-crushingly dull'. Interior designers are concerned.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Government buildings are repainted in neon. Public opinion is vibrant.
Beige remains a symbol of quiet neutrality. Campaigners call you bland.
A compromise color is offered. It is still basically beige.

cards.Title: Feline Domination Research
cards.Description: A fringe group presents 'evidence' that cats are secretly plotting global domination and demands government funding for further research. Paranoia or prescience?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Researchers study catnaps and purrs for seditious intent. Cats are uncooperative.
The public is reassured. Cats continue their mysterious ways, unobserved.
To gain inside knowledge. The cat mostly sleeps on important documents.

cards.Title: Currency Change: Bottle Caps
cards.Description: Economists propose replacing the national currency with bottle caps to 'prepare for a post-apocalyptic future' and 'simplify transactions'. Banks are horrified.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Economy thrown into chaos. Beverage companies become central banks.
Financial system remains stable. Apocalypse preppers are disappointed.
A collector's item. Does not affect actual monetary policy.

cards.Title: Post-Thinking Day Confusion
cards.Description: The 'National Think About Thinking Day' has passed. Many citizens report feeling 'existentially bewildered' and less productive than ever. What was the point?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A practical follow-up. Everyone focuses on very easy jobs.
A government report on the nation's collective thoughts. It's vague.
Pretend it never happened. The philosophers will remember.

cards.Title: Laughter Yoga International Incident
cards.Description: A visiting diplomat mistook a parliamentary laughter yoga session for a mockery of their national dance. Diplomatic relations are now 'hilariously strained'.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A serious apology is issued. The diplomat remains skeptical.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Invite them to join the laughter.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: They either embrace it or storm out, worsening the situation.
A vague explanation. The laughter yoga continues, more subdued.

cards.Title: Cats Demand Royalties
cards.Description: The 'Project Meow' researchers conclude cats are NOT plotting world domination, but ARE aware of their internet fame and demand royalties for meme usage.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A landmark decision. Cats become wealthy. Dogs demand equal rights.
Cats are displeased. Expect more hairballs on important papers.
A compromise. Cats are temporarily mollified by fishy treats.

cards.Title: Bottle Cap Counterfeiting Ring
cards.Description: The new bottle cap currency is popular, but a sophisticated counterfeiting ring using 3D printers is flooding the market with fake caps. Economic chaos looms.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Elite agents hunt for counterfeiters. It is surprisingly dangerous.
A new, secure digital bottle cap. Even more confusing.
Panic ensues as citizens try to determine cap authenticity.

cards.Title: National Slogan Contest
cards.Description: A contest to find a new national slogan is overrun by ironic and silly submissions. The current frontrunner is 'We are mostly harmless'.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The nation adopts a self-deprecating slogan. Tourists are amused.
A committee picks a boring slogan. Public prefers the joke one.
More silly slogans flood in. The problem gets worse.

cards.Title: Universal Basic Compliments
cards.Description: To boost self-esteem, a proposal for 'Universal Basic Compliments' ‚Äì citizens receive a daily government-issued compliment via text. Psychologists are intrigued.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Citizens receive gems like 'Your hair looks adequate today!'. Mixed results.
No state-sponsored flattery. Citizens must find their own validation.
Taxpayer money spent determining if 'nice shoes' is too generic.

cards.Title: Replace History with Musicals
cards.Description: A radical education reform: teach all national history exclusively through interpretive song and dance musical numbers. Historians are aghast, choreographers thrilled.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Strike up the History Jazz Hands!
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Students learn history via catchy tunes. Accuracy is... variable.
History remains fact-based and less prone to spontaneous dance breaks.
One key historical event is re-enacted through ballet. It is very long.

cards.Title: Gnome Garden Conspiracy
cards.Description: Anonymous sources claim your prized collection of garden gnomes is actually a sophisticated communication network for an international spy ring. Preposterous!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The public finds it amusing. The gnomes remain silent, watchful.
To prove innocence. Gnome enthusiasts are outraged. It proves nothing.
Your staff now spend time researching ceramic figurines.

cards.Title: Talk to Animals Institute
cards.Description: A charismatic scientist claims to have invented a device that allows humans to talk to animals, and seeks funding for a national institute. Could this be real?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: First conversations reveal squirrels mostly want nuts. Still, a breakthrough!
A potential revolution in interspecies communication is dismissed.
Your pet either reveals deep secrets or just asks for food.

cards.Title: Mandatory Public Napping Zones
cards.Description: Following the success of the (now disgraced) Napping League, a proposal for mandatory public napping zones in all city parks. Siesta for everyone!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Parks become quieter. Some concern over public snoring levels.
Nappers must remain discreet. Joggers rejoice.
A euphemism for napping zones. People see through it.

cards.Title: Official State Constellation
cards.Description: Astronomers propose naming an official 'State Constellation'. Options include 'The Great Bureaucrat' and 'The Questionable Expense'. A celestial honor awaits.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A new constellation for future generations to ignore.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: The night sky needs no additions.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Existing constellations remain sufficient. Astronomers grumble.
Internet polls suggest 'The Eternal Traffic Jam' is a strong contender.

cards.Title: Guerilla Gardening Movement
cards.Description: Activists are 'guerilla gardening' ‚Äì planting flowers and vegetables in neglected public spaces. It's beautification, but also technically vandalism.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The city becomes more vibrant. Some question the legality.
Unpopular move. Makes for bad PR with flower-lovers.
Channels the enthusiasm into a structured, bureaucratic program.

cards.Title: AI Writes Your Speeches
cards.Description: Your overworked speechwriter has started using an AI to generate your speeches. They are grammatically perfect but occasionally suggest world domination.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Let the AI cook. What could go wrong?
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Speeches become unpredictable, occasionally brilliant, often terrifying.
Speeches return to their usual, safe mediocrity. AI is sad.
Requires more of your time, but filters out the evil plots.

cards.Title: National Treasure Hunt Plan
cards.Description: To boost tourism and morale, the government plans a nationwide treasure hunt with cryptic clues hidden in historical landmarks. What could the prize be?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Mass public participation. Prize is 'bragging rights' and a small plaque.
A missed opportunity for fun. Treasure remains unfound.
The prize becomes a lifetime supply of their product. Less romantic.

cards.Title: Cloud Seeding for Fun Shapes
cards.Description: Scientists claim they can make clouds form specific fun shapes (like kittens or ice cream cones) using advanced cloud seeding. Environmentalists are skeptical.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: The skies become whimsical. Unforeseen meteorological side effects.
The sky remains a canvas of random beauty. Less chance of ice cream rain.
More studies on the aerodynamics of cirrus kittens.

cards.Title: Your Doppelganger Commits Crimes
cards.Description: Someone who looks exactly like you is committing minor, embarrassing crimes (like stealing garden gnomes). The media is having a field day with this.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A manhunt for your misbehaving twin. Public is captivated.
Few believe you. The doppelganger continues their petty crime spree.
A temporary fix. The doppelganger might get a new haircut too.

cards.Title: Rename Stars After Bureaucrats
cards.Description: A proposal to honor hardworking civil servants by renaming distant stars after them. For example, 'Delta Pavonis' becomes 'Brenda from Accounting Star'.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Bureaucrats are thrilled. Astronomers are not. The stars don't care.
Tradition upheld. Brenda remains un-starred, but still efficient.
A compromise. Smaller celestial bodies for smaller bureaucratic roles.

cards.Title: Underground Rave in Parliament Cellars
cards.Description: Security footage reveals a massive, unauthorized underground rave took place in the historic parliament cellars last night. Glow sticks were found.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A stern message is sent. The public wonders who organized it.
Nobody believes this. The playlist was apparently excellent.
The party is over, but the legend of the rave will live on.

cards.Title: National Debate: Spork vs Foon
cards.Description: A heated national debate erupts over the superior hybrid utensil: the Spork or the Foon. The cutlery industry is on edge. This is your moment to lead.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Spork loyalists rejoice! Foon proponents feel betrayed. Soup season is tense.
Foon enthusiasts celebrate! Spork users call for a recount.
A call for peace between Spork and Foon factions. Unlikely to work.

cards.Title: Pigeon Suit Union Demands
cards.Description: The newly unionized, suit-wearing pigeons are now demanding better quality silk lining for their tiny suits and longer lunch breaks (for pecking).

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A tense negotiation. Pigeons get polyester blend, slightly shorter breaks.
Robins are less demanding but struggle with the tiny briefcases.
A temporary appeasement. The suit quality issue remains.

cards.Title: Badger Mascot International Gaffe
cards.Description: The 'Confused Badger' mascot accidentally wandered into a live international summit broadcast, looking bewildered. It is now a global meme for political confusion.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Your nation becomes ironically famous for diplomatic bewilderment.
The world chuckles. The badger remains blissfully unaware.
The badger is taught to look thoughtfully confused, not erratically so.

cards.Title: Verbosity Tax Evasion Scandal
cards.Description: High-ranking officials are caught using complex code words and synonyms to evade the 'Tax on Sesquipedalianism'. Public trust in simple speech plummets.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A show trial ensues. The defendants use very long words in their defense.
Linguists rejoice. Government speeches become incomprehensible again.
Reward officials for using short words. They still find loopholes.

cards.Title: Whale Songs Attract Actual Whales
cards.Description: The whale song police sirens have had an unintended effect: pods of curious whales are now congregating in the city harbor, disrupting shipping.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A new tourism boom! Shipping companies are furious. Whales are majestic.
Whales are disappointed and swim away. Harbor traffic resumes.
Scientists try to find music whales dislike. Perhaps country?

cards.Title: Pigeon Suit Sabotage!
cards.Description: Rival bird factions (sparrows, mostly) are sabotaging the pigeons' tiny business suits, leading to wardrobe malfunctions at important pigeon press conferences.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Tiny earpieces and sunglasses. Protects pigeon dignity, escalates bird tensions.
Difficult negotiations. Sparrows demand equal suit representation.
More durable, but less breathable. Pigeons complain of chafing.

cards.Title: Badger Mascot for UN Secretary?
cards.Description: The 'Confused Badger' meme is so globally popular that a satirical campaign nominates it for UN Secretary General. Some nations are actually considering it.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: International politics becomes delightfully absurd. Badger is still confused.
A sensible move. The world sighs, a little disappointed.
A team is assembled to interpret badger's grunts into policy.

cards.Title: Simplified Language Act of Year XXXX
cards.Description: After the Verbosity Tax fiasco, your government passes the 'Simplified Language Act', mandating all official documents use words of one syllable only. It is hard.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Laws are short. Much is lost. Brains hurt less. Or more?

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: This law is bad. Stop this law.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A public outcry in very short words. The act is re-thought.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Teach all how to speak new way.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Big class. Much time. All learn. Slow. So slow.

cards.Title: Whale Conservation Empire
cards.Description: The urban whale watching is a massive success! Your nation is now a global leader in whale tourism and conservation, attracting marine biologists and tourists alike.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A bold new frontier in tourism. Very expensive. Whales are curious.
Major breakthroughs in cetacean studies. Less flashy, more substance.
Attempt to attract more species with different musical genres.

cards.Title: National Existential Crisis Day!
cards.Description: Following a series of bizarre government decisions, the entire nation has collectively declared an 'Existential Crisis Day'. Productivity is zero, philosophy majors are thriving.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Some are reassured, others see through it. Crisis deepens for some.
A temporary mood lift. Puppies are overwhelmed but helpful.
Massive public festivals and free ice cream. Avoids the issue entirely.

cards.Title: Slightly Used Asteroid Approaching!
cards.Description: Astronomers report a medium-sized, 'slightly used' asteroid (covered in graffiti) is on a collision course. Evacuation is impossible, panic is mandatory.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A clich√© plan, but it might just work. Or not. Very dramatic.
Public remains uninformed and doomed. A bold, idiotic strategy.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Paint a giant target on desert.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Hoping the asteroid has a sense of humor or good aim.

cards.Title: Gravity Inverted Locally!
cards.Description: A mishap at the experimental physics lab has inverted gravity in a five-block radius. People, cars, and pets are now stuck to the sky. Utter chaos!

MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: A desperate attempt to retrieve citizens. Many things get tangled.
Airdropping parachutes is tricky when 'up' is 'down' for them.

MultipleChoiceOptions.OptionText: Try to reverse the polarity again.
MultipleChoiceOptions.OutcomeDescription: Could fix it, or make everyone float sideways. High risk!
